functions-intro_key2: Function ek block of `code` hota hai jo ki run hota hai jab hum use call karte hai. Function mei hum data pass kar sekhte hai jise hum parameter kahete hai. Function data return karta hai. Functions ka use kar ke hum ek baar kuch `code` likh kar usko bahot baar use kar sakte hai. Isse humara kaam bahot aasan ho jata hai.
functions-intro_key3: Isko chala ke dekho. Iski `output` kuch aisi aayegi:
functions-intro_key4: Dhayn se dekho ki `code` mein jahan bhi `say_hello()` likha hai, wahan `Hello!` aur `Aap kaise ho?` waali lines print ho gayi hain. Yeh isliye hua hai kyunki humne ek baar doosri line mein `def say_hello()` ka use kar ke ek function likh diya. Ab jab bhi yeh function call hoga toh iske andar waala `code` chal jayega. Iss tareeke se hum baar baar ek `code` ko user kar sakte hain.
functions-intro_key6: Functions ka use karke hum kuch `code` ek baar likh ke usse baar baar wahi kaam karva sakte hain. Aap abhi tak bahot functions ka use kar chuke ho. Iss `code` ko padho:
functions-intro_key9: Yahan `len(names_list)` ka use kar ke humne jana ki list mein kitne item hai. Ab hum apne `code` mein `len` ka use kar kisi bhi list ke items ki ginti kar sakte hain. Yahan `len` ek function hai. Functions ke bina humein list ki items ki ginti nikalne ke liye baar baar `code` likhna padega. Isko behtar samajhne hum aage wale examples mein iska `code` khud likhenge.
functions-intro_key10: Hum ek function likhenge. Iss `code` ko pehle chala ke dekho, aur fir neeche padiye iske baare mein samajhne ke liye.
functions-intro_key12: Ek aur example FUNCTIONS samajhne ke liye. Iss `code` ko padh ke `output` socho. Chala ke dekhne ke baad dhyan se padho.
functions-intro_key13: Shuruat mein `def` ka use kar ke hum `python` ko bata rahe ki humne ek `definition_say_hello` naam ka function likha hai.
functions-intro_key14: ` ke neeche likha hua hai. Inn spaces se `python` samajh jata hai ki yeh function ka `code` hai.
functions-intro_key15: Fir agli line, `definition_say_hello()` mein humne function ko bulaya hai jisse function ke andar wala `code` chal jata hai. Isko **FUNCTION CALL** karna kehte hain.
functions-intro_key16: Aakhir mein humne firse `definition_say_hello()` likh ke function call ki hai. Ek aur baar function ek baar andar wale `code` ko chala deti hai. Isse andar waali jo function ke andar `code` hai - yaani - *2 print* command chal jati hai.
functions-intro_key17:
`python`
def function_say_bye():
    print ("Aapko mil ke maza aaya. ")
    print ("Bye bye")
function_say_bye()
function_say_bye()
print ("`Python` ka istamaal bahot jagah hota hai.")
function_say_bye()
function_say_bye()
functions-intro_key18: Hum `python` mein `def` `key`word ka use kar ke function banate hain. `def` ke baad function ka naam, `function_say_bye` likha hain. Naam ke baad hum do bracket `(` `)` lagate hain.
functions-intro_key19: Bracket ke baad ek colon, `:` lagate hain. `Python` semicolon se samajh jaati hai ki function ka `code` shuru ho raha hai.
functions-intro_key20: Dekhiye ki sara function ka `code` indent (space) deke likha hua hai. Isse `python` ko samajh aata hai ki yeh function ke andar ka `code` hai.
functions-intro_key21: `print ("Bye bye")` ke baad `code` space diye bina likha hua hai. Isse `python` ko samajh aati hai ki function ka `code` kahatam ho gaya hai
functions-intro_key22: functions ko bhi `variables` ko naam dene ke rules ke hisaab se hi naam dete hain. yaad rakhne ke liye ek baar `variables` ko naam dene ke rules yaad rakh li jiye.
functions-intro_key24: Neeche diye gaye `code` ko likhiye aur dekhiye ki iska koi `output` aa raha hai ya nahi. Nahi aa raha toh kyun nahi aa rahi?
functions-intro_key25: Ab apne `code` mein yeh line add karein aur dekhein ki koi `output` aati hai.
functions-intro_key27: `Python` mein sirf function likh dene se function ka `code` chalta nahi hai. Yahan pehle humne def `key`word ka use karke `python` ko function ka `code` bataya. Isko **"FUNCTION DEFINITION"** kehte hain.
functions-intro_key28: Fir humne baad mein `definition_hello_again()` likh ke function ko bulaya aur usme likha hua `code` chalwaya. Isko **"FUNCTION CALL"** karna kehte hain. **"FUNCTION CALL"** mein hum function ke naam ke baad 2 bracket `(` `)` lagate hain. Isse `python` ko pata chalta hai ki function ke andar ka `code` chalana hai.
